channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deep Generative Mixture Model for Robust Imbalance Classification
item.description: In this paper, a deep generative classifier is proposed to mitigate this issue via both model perturbation and data perturbation.

item.title: Spacerini: Plug-and-play Search Engines with Pyserini and Hugging Face
item.description: We present Spacerini, a modular framework for seamless building and deployment of interactive search applications, designed to facilitate the qualitative analysis of large scale research datasets.

item.title: GLM-Dialog: Noise-tolerant Pre-training for Knowledge-grounded Dialogue Generation
item.description: We present GLM-Dialog, a large-scale language model (LLM) with 10B parameters capable of knowledge-grounded conversation in Chinese using a search engine to access the Internet knowledge.

item.title: Im2Hands: Learning Attentive Implicit Representation of Interacting Two-Hand Shapes
item.description: To handle the shape complexity and interaction context between two hands, Im2Hands models the occupancy volume of two hands - conditioned on an RGB image and coarse 3D keypoints - by two novel attention-based modules responsible for (1) initial occupancy estimation and (2) context-aware occupancy refinement, respectively.

item.title: Memory-aided Contrastive Consensus Learning for Co-salient Object Detection
item.description: To learn better group consensus, we propose the Group Consensus Aggregation Module (GCAM) to abstract the common features of each image group; meanwhile, to make the consensus representation more discriminative, we introduce the Memory-based Contrastive Module (MCM), which saves and updates the consensus of images from different groups in a queue of memories.

item.title: The In-Sample Softmax for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We highlight a simple fact: it is more straightforward to approximate an in-sample \emph{softmax} using only actions in the dataset.

item.title: Learning to Control Autonomous Fleets from Observation via Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Autonomous Mobility-on-Demand (AMoD) systems are a rapidly evolving mode of transportation in which a centrally coordinated fleet of self-driving vehicles dynamically serves travel requests.

item.title: Towards Surgical Context Inference and Translation to Gestures
item.description: We evaluate the performance of each stage of our method by comparing the results with the ground truth segmentation masks, the consensus context labels, and the gesture labels in the JIGSAWS dataset.

item.title: PA&DA: Jointly Sampling PAth and DAta for Consistent NAS
item.description: Our method only requires negligible computation cost for optimizing the sampling distributions of path and data, but achieves lower gradient variance during supernet training and better generalization performance for the supernet, resulting in a more consistent NAS.

item.title: Decentralised construction of a global coordinate system in a large swarm of minimalistic robots
item.description: Despite being unable to measure the bearing of incoming messages, the robots running our algorithm can calculate their position within a swarm deployed in a regular formation.

item.title: Nonlinear Intensity, Scale and Rotation Invariant Matching for Multimodal Images
item.description: We present an effective method for the matching of multimodal images.

item.title: IQ-Flow: Mechanism Design for Inducing Cooperative Behavior to Self-Interested Agents in Sequential Social Dilemmas
item.description: In order to resolve this issue, we propose the Incentive Q-Flow (IQ-Flow) algorithm, which modifies the system's reward setup with an incentive regulator agent such that the cooperative policy also corresponds to the self-interested policy for the agents.

item.title: HelixSurf: A Robust and Efficient Neural Implicit Surface Learning of Indoor Scenes with Iterative Intertwined Regularization
item.description: Recovery of an underlying scene geometry from multiview images stands as a long-time challenge in computer vision research.

item.title: Meta Learning to Bridge Vision and Language Models for Multimodal Few-Shot Learning
item.description: Existing methods are trying to communicate visual concepts as prompts to frozen language models, but rely on hand-engineered task induction to reduce the hypothesis space.

item.title: A Closer Look at the Intervention Procedure of Concept Bottleneck Models
item.description: Concept bottleneck models (CBMs) are a class of interpretable neural network models that predict the target response of a given input based on its high-level concepts.

item.title: Instruction Clarification Requests in Multimodal Collaborative Dialogue Games: Tasks, and an Analysis of the CoDraw Dataset
item.description: In visual instruction-following dialogue games, players can engage in repair mechanisms in face of an ambiguous or underspecified instruction that cannot be fully mapped to actions in the world.

item.title: PCR-CG: Point Cloud Registration via Deep Color and Geometry
item.description: Different from previous methods that only use geometry representation, our module is specifically designed to effectively correlate color into geometry for the point cloud registration task.

item.title: ProxyFormer: Proxy Alignment Assisted Point Cloud Completion with Missing Part Sensitive Transformer
item.description: Specifically, we fuse information into point proxy via feature and position extractor, and generate features for missing point proxies from the features of existing point proxies.

item.title: Goal Driven Discovery of Distributional Differences via Language Descriptions
item.description: Mining large corpora can generate useful discoveries but is time-consuming for humans.

item.title: Global Proxy-based Hard Mining for Visual Place Recognition
item.description: These proxy representations are thus used to construct a global index that encompasses the similarities between all places in the dataset, allowing for highly informative mini-batch sampling at each training iteration.

item.title: In-Context Instruction Learning
item.description: Instruction learning of Large Language Models (LLMs) has enabled zero-shot task generalization.

item.title: Text classification dataset and analysis for Uzbek language
item.description: We also present a comprehensive evaluation of different models, ranging from traditional bag-of-words models to deep learning architectures, on this newly created dataset.

item.title: Interpretable and Intervenable Ultrasonography-based Machine Learning Models for Pediatric Appendicitis
item.description: Appendicitis is among the most frequent reasons for pediatric abdominal surgeries.

item.title: Neural Video Compression with Diverse Contexts
item.description: Better yet, our codec has surpassed the under-developing next generation traditional codec/ECM in both RGB and YUV420 colorspaces, in terms of PSNR.

item.title: HugNLP: A Unified and Comprehensive Library for Natural Language Processing
item.description: In this paper, we introduce HugNLP, a unified and comprehensive library for natural language processing (NLP) with the prevalent backend of HuggingFace Transformers, which is designed for NLP researchers to easily utilize off-the-shelf algorithms and develop novel methods with user-defined models and tasks in real-world scenarios.

item.title: Learned Risk Metric Maps for Kinodynamic Systems
item.description: We present Learned Risk Metric Maps (LRMM) for real-time estimation of coherent risk metrics of high dimensional dynamical systems operating in unstructured, partially observed environments.

item.title: Particle-based Online Bayesian Sampling
item.description: Online optimization has gained increasing interest due to its capability of tracking real-world streaming data.

item.title: Toward Robust Uncertainty Estimation with Random Activation Functions
item.description: Deep neural networks are in the limelight of machine learning with their excellent performance in many data-driven applications.

item.title: DECOR-NET: A COVID-19 Lung Infection Segmentation Network Improved by Emphasizing Low-level Features and Decorrelating Features
item.description: Since 2019, coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) has been widely spread and posed a serious threat to public health.

item.title: Meta-Learning with Adaptive Weighted Loss for Imbalanced Cold-Start Recommendation
item.description: To alleviate this limitation, we propose a novel sequential recommendation framework based on gradient-based meta-learning that captures the imbalance of each user's rating distribution and accordingly computes adaptive loss for user-specific learning.

item.title: RoPAWS: Robust Semi-supervised Representation Learning from Uncurated Data
item.description: Semi-supervised learning aims to train a model using limited labels.

item.title: Interactive Segmentation as Gaussian Process Classification
item.description: Against this issue, in this paper, we propose to formulate the IS task as a Gaussian process (GP)-based pixel-wise binary classification model on each image.

item.title: Information-Restricted Neural Language Models Reveal Different Brain Regions' Sensitivity to Semantics, Syntax and Context
item.description: A fundamental question in neurolinguistics concerns the brain regions involved in syntactic and semantic processing during speech comprehension, both at the lexical (word processing) and supra-lexical levels (sentence and discourse processing).

item.title: Learning to Super-Resolve Blurry Images with Events
item.description: Super-Resolution from a single motion Blurred image (SRB) is a severely ill-posed problem due to the joint degradation of motion blurs and low spatial resolution.

item.title: Layer Grafted Pre-training: Bridging Contrastive Learning And Masked Image Modeling For Label-Efficient Representations
item.description: This motivates us to shift the paradigm from combining loss at the end, to choosing the proper learning method per network layer.

item.title: LLaMA: Open and Efficient Foundation Language Models
item.description: We introduce LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models ranging from 7B to 65B parameters.

item.title: Multi-Feature Integration for Perception-Dependent Examination-Bias Estimation
item.description: Eliminating examination bias accurately is pivotal to apply click-through data to train an unbiased ranking model.

item.title: Evaluating Robustness and Uncertainty of Graph Models Under Structural Distributional Shifts
item.description: To evaluate the performance of graph models, it is important to test them on diverse and meaningful distributional shifts.

item.title: TabGenie: A Toolkit for Table-to-Text Generation
item.description: We present TabGenie - a toolkit which enables researchers to explore, preprocess, and analyze a variety of data-to-text generation datasets through the unified framework of table-to-text generation.

item.title: FedCLIP: Fast Generalization and Personalization for CLIP in Federated Learning
item.description: Concretely, we design an attention-based adapter for the large model, CLIP, and the rest operations merely depend on adapters.

item.title: Causal isotonic calibration for heterogeneous treatment effects
item.description: We propose causal isotonic calibration, a novel nonparametric method for calibrating predictors of heterogeneous treatment effects.

item.title: Neural Graph Revealers
item.description: Sparse graph recovery methods work well where the data follows their assumptions but often they are not designed for doing downstream probabilistic queries.

item.title: Inseq: An Interpretability Toolkit for Sequence Generation Models
item.description: Past work in natural language processing interpretability focused mainly on popular classification tasks while largely overlooking generation settings, partly due to a lack of dedicated tools.

item.title: kNN-BOX: A Unified Framework for Nearest Neighbor Generation
item.description: Augmenting the base neural model with a token-level symbolic datastore is a novel generation paradigm and has achieved promising results in machine translation (MT).

item.title: The Role of Pre-training Data in Transfer Learning
item.description: We investigate the impact of pre-training data distribution on the few-shot and full fine-tuning performance using 3 pre-training methods (supervised, contrastive language-image and image-image), 7 pre-training datasets, and 9 downstream datasets.

item.title: Self Correspondence Distillation for End-to-End Weakly-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In addition, to further improve the segmentation accuracy, we design a Variation-aware Refine Module to enhance the local consistency of pseudo-labels by computing pixel-level variation.

item.title: Aligning Bag of Regions for Open-Vocabulary Object Detection
item.description: The embeddings of regions in a bag are treated as embeddings of words in a sentence, and they are sent to the text encoder of a VLM to obtain the bag-of-regions embedding, which is learned to be aligned to the corresponding features extracted by a frozen VLM.

item.title: Extrapolated cross-validation for randomized ensembles
item.description: Our method builds on two main ingredients: two initial estimators for small ensemble sizes using out-of-bag errors and a novel risk extrapolation technique leveraging the structure of the prediction risk decomposition.

item.title: Injectivity of ReLU networks: perspectives from statistical physics
item.description: Recent work connects this problem to spherical integral geometry giving rise to a conjectured sharp injectivity threshold for $\alpha = \frac{m}{n}$ by studying the expected Euler characteristic of a certain random set.

item.title: An Embedded and Real-Time Pupil Detection Pipeline
item.description: For evaluation on our hardware-specific camera frames, we also contribute a dataset of 35000 images, from 20 participants.
